On #HealthcareWeekend, hard-working Americans are facing escalating Rx costs, fear of paying more for pre-existing conditions, and terrifying out-of-pocket expenses.

At 10:30pm I'm joining @AriMelber on @MSNBC to discuss the need to protect healthcare for all Americans.

What we heard today from experts and patients was not an academic or partisan debate – it was about life and death for too many of us. 

The House has passed real, life changing legislation to lower the cost of healthcare in our country. 

Now @Senatemajldr must schedule a vote. pic.twitter.com/fJXEiIXlpR

People stop me everywhere I go and the biggest concerns they have are around health care. People are scared, worried, fearful, and panicked. They need access to quality, affordable health care. And they need it now!

We all have heard stories from our communities of people delaying or skipping treatment or drugs because of escalating prescription costs, fear of paying more for pre-existing conditions, and terrifying out-of-pocket expenses. 

That is unacceptable. pic.twitter.com/Vh0r4atoyg

Without protections for pre-existing conditions, insurers can DENY COVERAGE and make patients PAY MORE. Everyone knows someone with a pre-existing condition. That’s why we must make sure no one can be denied coverage. pic.twitter.com/JfZFor5JKf

 https://www.facebook.com/RepDebbieDingell/videos/661565437603403/ …

SOON: We are going live at 2:00PM with experts and patients to talk about the increasing cost of healthcare and prescription drugs.

Nearly 30 MILLION Americans are uninsured. Another 40 million cannot afford the costs of their co-pays or deductibles. That is unacceptable. We need change. We need #MedicareforAll

#MedicareForAll will streamline our fragmented healthcare system. It will expand and improve coverage for every American.

No longer will people from Michigan drive to Canada to get affordable medication. 

No longer will people go bankrupt after visiting the doctor.

Today’s hearing on universal coverage is about fixing a broken system.

President Obama said of John Dingell on this journey, “he reminds us change takes time, it takes courage & persistence. If we push hard enough & long enough, change is possible.” 

Today, change is in sight.

With #MedicareForAll you get:

➡️Lower cost of prescription drugs

➡️Guaranteed coverage

➡️Money saved to start a small business

It’s time we treat healthcare as a right and give everyone the coverage they need.

Protecting people with pre-existing conditions is not some academic or partisan debate. Access to healthcare means life or death for people.

The mother of a child with diabetes stopped me because she was worried about her child’s future. It’s terrible to think that the Administration would try to take away coverage for that little girl. Health coverage is very real for that little girl, & millions of other Americans.

Pre-existing conditions range from Cancer and Lupus, to diabetes and sleep apnea. It’s inconceivable that those who already have an illness would be denied the treatment they need. We must do all we can to strengthen coverage for those with pre-existing conditions.
House Democrats know that access to quality, affordable healthcare is a necessity and a right. We will not stop speaking up.

We are live with Peter Morley to discuss the work of House Democrats to protect people with pre-existing conditions. https://www.pscp.tv/w/b8fm5DFkclFlR21EcGFqYkd8MWVhS2J2bEFlYnJLWJVoxkDoK-5PUN1pXRb3MZpV9DzL_CETOy4MIqIEJYnb …
